claim.text: We identify two fundamental axioms—Sensitivity and Implementation Invariance that attribution methods ought to satisfy.
claim.exact_quote: We identify two fundamental axioms—_Sensitivity and Implementation Invariance that_ attribution methods ought to satisfy.

evidence.evidence_text: We identify two fundamental axioms—_Sensitivity and Implementation Invariance that_ attribution methods ought to satisfy.
evidence.exact_quote: We identify two fundamental axioms—_Sensitivity and Implementation Invariance that_ attribution methods ought to satisfy.

evidence.evidence_text: We show that they are not satisfied by most known attribution methods, which we consider to be a fundamental weakness of those methods.
evidence.exact_quote: We show that they are not satisfied by most known attribution methods, which we consider to be a fundamental weakness of those methods.

claim.text: Integrated Gradients is a new attribution method guided by the identified axioms.
claim.exact_quote: We use the axioms to guide the design of a new attribution method called Integrated Gradients.

evidence.evidence_text: We use the axioms to guide the design of a new attribution method called Integrated Gradients.
evidence.exact_quote: We use the axioms to guide the design of a new attribution method called Integrated Gradients.

evidence.evidence_text: Our method requires no modification to the original network and is extremely simple to implement; it just needs a few calls to the standard gradient operator.
evidence.exact_quote: Our method requires no modification to the original network and is extremely simple to implement; it just needs a few calls to the standard gradient operator.

evidence.evidence_text: We apply this method to a couple of image models, a couple of text models and a chemistry model, demonstrating its ability to debug networks, to extract rules from a network, and to enable users to engage with models better.

claim.text: Integrated Gradients can be used to identify novel question classification rules in natural language processing.
claim.exact_quote: attributions help identify novel question classification rules, for e.g., questions containing “total number” are seeking numeric answers.

evidence.evidence_text: Integrated Gradients can be used to identify novel question classification rules in natural language processing.

conclusion.key_limitations: Identifying novel rules may depend on the specific dataset and model

claim.text: Integrated Gradients provides a strong theoretical justification for its approach.
claim.exact_quote: The primary contribution of this paper is a method called integrated gradients that attributes the prediction of a deep network to its inputs.

claim.text: The axiomatic approach clarifies desirable features of an attribution method.
